hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Hurayrah from the Prophet ﷺ: When one of you awakens from sleep, do not plunge your hand into the vessel until you wash it three times, because he does not know where his hand has been during the night

narrators.name: Abu Ubaidah
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Yusuf ibn Hikam al-Hadani

narrators.name: Jabir ibn Zayd
narrators.full_name: Jabir ibn Zayd ibn Alim al-Azdi

narrators.name: Abu Hurayrah
narrators.full_name: Abd al-Rahman ibn Sakhr ad-Dusi
narrators.alternative_names: Abu Hurayrah al-Dusi, Abd al-Rahman al-Dusi

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim
narrators.alternative_names: Ahmad, al-Mustafa, the Messenger of Allah

chainIssues: First narrator Abu Ubaidah is classified as weak (Da'if) - this is the main weakness
Second narrator Jabir ibn Zayd has issues with memory according to several scholars
Both Abu Ubaidah and Jabir ibn Zayd use عَنْ which is ambiguous transmission term

potential_issues.issue: Abu Ubaidah (Muhammad ibn Yusuf al-Hadani) is graded as Da'if
potential_issues.impact: This is a critical weakness in the chain. Many early scholars including Abu Hatim considered him abandoned (matruk). This significantly affects hadith authenticity.

potential_issues.issue: Jabir ibn Zayd uses ambiguous عَنْ transmission term
potential_issues.impact: While Jabir ibn Zayd is generally acceptable, his weak memory and the ambiguous transmission term create some doubts about the connection.

potential_issues.issue: Chain structure has multiple weak links
potential_issues.impact: The combination of Abu Ubaidah's weakness and Jabir ibn Zayd's memory issues makes this hadith unreliable.

Topics: Ablution method after waking from sleep
Washing hands before using water vessels

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ibn Abbas from the Prophet ﷺ: There is no ablution for one who does not mention the name of Allah upon it. Al-Rabi' said: Abu Ubaidah said: That is an encouragement from the Prophet ﷺ for achieving great rewards in mentioning Allah

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ibn Abbas from the Prophet ﷺ: He performed ablution once and said, This is ablution without which prayer is not accepted. Then he performed ablution twice twice and said, Whoever doubles doubling Allah doubles for him. Then he performed ablution three times three times and said, This is my ablution and the ablution of the prophets before me

hadiths.english_translation: In another narration from Ibn Abbas with this chain he said to al-Qit ibn Sabrah or someone else: When you perform ablution, put water in your nose then blow it out. Abu Ubaidah from Jabir ibn Zayd said: It reached me from the Messenger of Allah ﷺ: He rinsed and sniffed from one handful. Abu Ubaidah from Jabir ibn Zayd said: It reached me that the Messenger of Allah ﷺ was accustomed to using a towel to wipe himself after ablution, and some of his wives would hand it to him so he would dry himself with it. Al-Rabi' said: Abu Ubaidah said: What is practiced among us is that he does not wipe his limbs after ablution and this is an encouragement from the people of knowledge and an incentive for them to achieve great rewards as long as the water is on his limbs. Abu Ubaidah from Jabir ibn Zayd from Ibn Abbas from the Prophet ﷺ: He wiped part of his head during ablution

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Hurayrah: The Prophet ﷺ said: When the Muslim slave performs ablution and washes his face, every sin which he looked at with his eyes comes out from his face with the last drop of water. When he washes his hands, every sin which he committed with his hands comes out from his hands, then likewise until he comes out pure from sins

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Ubaidah from Jabir ibn Zayd: It reached me from Uthman ibn Affan that he sat on the benches when the muezzin came and called the Adhan for Asr prayer. He called for water and performed ablution then said: By Allah, I will narrate to you a hadith which if it were not in the Book of Allah I would not have narrated it to you. Then he said: I heard the Messenger of Allah ﷺ say: There is no person who performs ablution and perfects his ablution for his prayer then prays it, except Allah forgives him what is between it and the next prayer until he prays it. Al-Rabi' said: He means by his statement 'if it were not in the Book of Allah' the saying of Allah the Mighty and Majestic: And establish the prayer at both ends of the day and at some hours of the night. Indeed good deeds do away with misdeeds. That is a reminder for those who remember (Quran 11:114)

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Ubaidah from Jabir ibn Zayd: It reached me from Ali ibn Abi Talib that he ordered al-Miqdad ibn al-Aswad to ask the Prophet ﷺ about a man who approached his family and pre-seminal fluid came out, what is upon him? Ali said: I am shy of the Messenger of Allah ﷺ to ask him because I have his daughter with me. So al-Miqdad came to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ and asked him about that. He said: If one of you finds that, let him splash his penis with water then perform the ablution of prayer
